author: Special Correspondent
text:
Farmers submitting a petition to District CollectorK.S. Palanisamy demanding dredging of Uyyakondan in Tiruchi on Monday.— PHOTO: B. VELANKANNI RAJ

Members of Tamil Nadu Vivasayigal Sangam have urged the district administration to take steps for dredging the Uyyakondan river.

In a memorandum to K.S. Palanisamy, District Collector, the office-bearers of the sangam said that parts of the banks of the river had been encroached upon and the district administration should take action. Thick growth of vegetation was another problem.

Ayilai Siva Suriyan, district secretary of the sangam, said that farmers cultivating banana, sugarcane, and paddy had been affected.

M. Subramanian, District president, said the embankments should be re-built and strengthened with concrete structure to restore the irrigation facility through the river. Focus should be on the tail-end of the river between Ariyamangalam and Valavandankottai, they said.
title: Farmers’ association seeks dredging of Uyyakondan
